message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI

The paper deals with privacy and statistical inference, which are both central topics in the field of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also uses information theory (cs.IT) to develop a non-asymptotic approach for characterizing privacy. Additionally, the paper proposes privacy metrics and a design problem that can be formulated as a convex program, which are topics in machine learning (cs.LG) and optimization (cs.DS). Finally, the paper compares its framework with differential privacy, which is a popular approach to privacy preservation in computer science (cs.SI).
